content.text: Good, I can see the relevant columns: `cardKingdomFoilId`, `cardKingdomId`, and `frameEffects`. Now let me query for the most common frame effect on cards where both `cardKingdomFoilId` and `cardKingdomId` are not null.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/card_games.sqlite" "SELECT frameEffects, COUNT(*) as cnt FROM cards WHERE cardKingdomFoilId IS NOT NULL AND cardKingdomId IS NOT NULL AND frameEffects IS NOT NULL AND frameEffects != '' GROUP BY frameEffects ORDER BY cnt DESC LIMIT 10;"
input.description: Find most common frameEffects for powerful foil cards

content.text:
The query results clearly show that **"legendary"** is the most common frame effect among cards where both `cardKingdomFoilId` and `cardKingdomId` are not null (i.e., "incredibly powerful foil cards"), with 528 occurrences — significantly more than the second most common "extendedart" at 342.

The hint also confirms that "most common visual frame effects" corresponds to `MAX(frameEffects)` by count, which aligns with this interpretation.

The claim states "Legendary is the predominant frame effect seen on incredibly powerful foil cards," which matches the data perfectly.

This confirms the claim that legendary is the predominant frame effect on these cards."}
